FLL CARGO CONNECT Strategy Planner: Planificador de estrategia de FLL CARGO CONNECT
FLL Explore Review Sheet: Hoja de revisión de FLL Explore
FLL Tournament Scoring System: Sistema de puntuación de torneo FLL
Does all your equipment fit in the small: (ES)Does all your equipment fit in the small inspection area?
Is any part of the model touching the CA: (ES)Is any part of the model touching the CARGO CONNECT circle?
The model must be made of at least two w: (ES)The model must be made of at least two white LEGO pieces and measures at least as long as four LEGO 'studs' in some direction.
Is the hinged container completely close: (ES)Is the hinged container completely closed and partly full of contents (1-5 content pieces) or completely full of contents (All 6 content pieces)?
Has the cargo plane been prepared for un: (ES)Has the cargo plane been prepared for unloading so that the cargo door rests completely down, touching its black frame?
Has the cargo plane been unloaded so tha: (ES)Has the cargo plane been unloaded so that the container is completely separate from the plane?
Has the truck reached its destination, c: (ES)Has the truck reached its destination, completely past its blue end line, on the mat?
Has the airplane reached its destination: (ES)Has the airplane reached its destination, completely past its blue end line, on the mat?
Has the engine been switched from diesel: (ES)Has the engine been switched from diesel to electric so that the yellow bar rests all the way down/south?
Is your robot parked over the blue accid: (ES)Is your robot parked over the blue accident-avoidance line at the end of the match and the yellow panel is not knocked down
(ES)Is your robot parked over the blue accident-avoidance line at the end of the match and the yellow panel is knocked down?
If the black frame is knocked down at th: (ES)If the black frame is knocked down at the end of the match, this mission does not score.
Is the container no longer touching the: (ES)Is the container no longer touching the cargo ship’s east deck?
Is the container completely east of the: (ES)Is the container completely east of the cargo ship’s east deck?
Is the food package separated from your: (ES)Is the food package separated from your helicopter?
Is the food package separated from the o: (ES)Is the food package separated from the other field’s helicopter and is completely in your field’s CARGO CONNECT circle?
Have both teams separated their food pac: (ES)Have both teams separated their food packages from their field’s helicopters?
Is the train track repaired so that it r: (ES)Is the train track repaired so that it rests completely down/west?
Has the train reached its destination, l: (ES)Has the train reached its destination, latched at the end of the tracks?
Have the containers been sorted so that: (ES)Have the containers been sorted so that the light orange container is the only container remaining completely in the blue sorting area box?
Has the package been delivered to its de: (ES)Has the package been delivered to its destination so that it is partly on the doorstep?
(ES)Has the package been delivered to its destination so that it is completely on the doorstep?
The package does not score if it is touc: (ES)The package does not score if it is touching any equipment at the end of the match.
Is the turbine blade touching only the b: (ES)Is the turbine blade touching only the blue holder and the mat?
(ES)Is the turbine blade touching only the blue holder and nothing else?
Is the chicken statue upright with its b: (ES)Is the chicken statue upright with its base partly or completely in its circle?
Are both trucks latched together complet: (ES)Are both trucks latched together completely outside of home?
Is a truck latched to the bridge?: (ES)Is a truck latched to the bridge?
How many bridge decks have been lowered: (ES)How many bridge decks have been lowered and rest on their center support?
How many containers are on and touching: (ES)How many containers are on and touching only the platooning trucks?
(ES)How many containers are on and touching only the train?
(ES)How many containers are on and touching only the cargo ship's west deck?
Containers on Platooning Trucks must be: (ES)Containers on Platooning Trucks must be completely outside of home.
How many containers are partly in any ci: (ES)How many containers are partly in any circle?
How many containers are completely in an: (ES)How many containers are completely in any circle?
Is the blue (not hinged) container compl: (ES)Is the blue (not hinged) container completely in the blue circle?
Is the lime green container completely i: (ES)Is the lime green container completely in the lime green circle?
How many circles are there with at least: (ES)How many circles are there with at least one container completely in them?
How many Precision Tokens are left on th: ¿Cuántas testigos de precisión quedan en el terreno de juego?
Gracious Professionalism® displayed at t: (ES)Gracious Professionalism® displayed at the robot game table
Instructions: The Core Values should be: (ES)Instructions: The Core Values should be the lens through which you watch the team’s presentations. All team members should be demonstrating the Core Values in everything they do. This rubric should be used to record the Core Values observed thoughout the judging session.
If the team is a candidate for one of th: (ES)If the team is a candidate for one of these awards, please tick the appropriate box:
Breakthrough Award - A team that made si: (ES)Breakthrough Award - A team that made significant progress in their confidence and capability and who understand that what they discover is more important than what they win
Rising All-Star - A team that the judges: (ES)Rising All-Star - A team that the judges notice and expect great things from in the future
Motivate - A team that embraces the cult: (ES)Motivate - A team that embraces the culture of FIRST LEGO League through team building, team spirit, and displayed enthusiam
Discovery - Team explored new skills and: (ES)Discovery - Team explored new skills and ideas.
Innovation - Team used creativity and pe: (ES)Innovation - Team used creativity and persistance to solve problems
Impact - Team applied what they learned: (ES)Impact - Team applied what they learned to improve their world
Inclusion - Team demonstrated respect an: (ES)Inclusion - Team demonstrated respect and embraced their differences
Teamwork - Team clearly showed they had: (ES)Teamwork - Team clearly showed they had worked as a team throughout their journey
Fun - Team clearly had fun and celebrate: (ES)Fun - Team clearly had fun and celebrated what they had achieved
Instructions: Teams should communicate t: (ES)Instructions: Teams should communicate to the judges their achievement in each of the criteria below. This rubric should be filled out during the Innovation Project presentation.
Judges are required to tick one box on a: (ES)Judges are required to tick one box on a separate line to indicate the level the team has achieved. If the team exceeds, please make a short comment in the Exceeds box.
Identify - Team had a clearly defined pr: (ES)Identify - Team had a clearly defined problem that was well researched.
Partial research from more than one sour: (ES)Partial research from more than one source
Clear, detailed research from a variety: (ES)Clear, detailed research from a variety of sources
Design - Team generated innovative ideas: (ES)Design - Team generated innovative ideas independently before selecting and planning which one to develop.
Minimal evidence of an inclusive selecti: (ES)Minimal evidence of an inclusive selection process
Partial evidence of an inclusive selecti: (ES)Partial evidence of an inclusive selection process
Clear evidence of an inclusive selection: (ES)Clear evidence of an inclusive selection process
Create - Team developed an original idea: (ES)Create - Team developed an original idea or built on an existing one with a prototype model/drawing to represent their solution.
Simple model/drawing that helps to share: (ES)Simple model/drawing that helps to share the solution
Detailed model/drawing that helps to sha: (ES)Detailed model/drawing that helps to share the solution
Iterate - Teams shared their ideas, coll: (ES)Iterate - Teams shared their ideas, collected feedback, and included improvements in their solution.
Shared their solution with user OR profe: (ES)Shared their solution with user OR professional
Shared their solution with user AND prof: (ES)Shared their solution with user AND professional
Minimal evidence of improvements in thei: (ES)Minimal evidence of improvements in their solution
Partial evidence of improvements in thei: (ES)Partial evidence of improvements in their solution
Clear evidence of improvements in their: (ES)Clear evidence of improvements in their solution
Communicate - Team shared a creative and: (ES)Communicate - Team shared a creative and effective presentation of their current solution and its impact on their users.
Solution and its potential impact on oth: (ES)Solution and its potential impact on others unclear
(ES)Solution and its potential impact on others partially clear
(ES)Solution and its potential impact on others clear

Communicate - Team's explanation of the: (ES)Communicate - Team's explanation of the robot design process was effective and showed how all team members have been involved.

Coding Award - These teams gave effectiv: (ES)Coding Award - These teams gave effective explanations about how their code made their team models move and showed good communication skills.
Challenge Solution Award - These teams: (ES)Challenge Solution Award -  These teams showed excellent problem-solving skills to create an innovative and helpful solution to the challenge.
Team Poster Award - These teams showed c: (ES)Team Poster Award - These teams showed creativity on their team poster and clearly explained what they had learned through their FIRST(R) LEGO(R) League Explore team journey
Core Values Award - These teams demonstr: (ES)Core Values Award - These teams demonstrated great teamwork as they explored the challenge, showing they fully understood the FIRST® Core Values.
Team Model Award - These teams displayed: (ES)Team Model Award - These teams displayed innovation and creativity through the design and building of their team models.
What did your team learn about the chall: (ES)What did your team learn about the challenge?
The team learned about the challenge and: (ES)The team learned about the challenge and explored the multiple solutions.
The team’s solution has the potential to: (ES)The team’s solution has the potential to make a great impact on the community.
Team members explained how they worked a: (ES)Team members explained how they worked as a team and understood the Core Values giving examples
What skills did you learn from each othe: (ES)What skills did you learn from each other?
Team members showed they had learned new: (ES)Team members showed they had learned new skills when working together.
The team described the team model and th: (ES)The team described the team model and the solutions to the challenge that it represented.
Did you include the treadmill, the heart: (ES)Did you include the treadmill, the heart game, or the combined build?
